intro: Freziera reticulata, commonly known as the net-veined freziera, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in the spring. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, with a distinctive net-like venation pattern. Freziera reticulata is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in cool, moist conditions.
